place_description: Bustling taproom & beer garden offering in-house sandwiches & international food-truck fare.

reviews_data.review_text: Grace was an AMAZING bartender!! She truly made this bachelorette weekend feel so special! 10/10 recommend going here!!!
We liked the location the food and drinks. It was so loud! I love life music I couldn't sit outside because of the volume.
Crowds are crazy on a Wednesday! Amazing energy but sometimes overwhelming
Kendra is the BEST! 12/10 recommend! Makes the best drinks and pours the best beers!
Run club every Wednesday night at 1830hrs

Music is so obnoxiously loud that you can't even communicate with the people you're hanging out with. Not sure if it's trying to be a brewery or a nightclub, but it doesn't do a good job of either. Then the final straw was the $10 they charged me for a coffee. I have never been charged that much for a latte anywhere in the world, even with extra shots of coffee. Avoid this place.
Maya is the best, what incredible service. Always has the best beer suggestions for me and everyone I bring
I come here ton for run clubs and on weekends and it's an amazing place. I bring my dog Cooper and he knows exactly who to go to for extra treats (it's Maya lol).
great spot to hangout with friends! dog friendly and they have some nonalcoholic selection too which was nice. atmosphere was very minimalistic yet inviting and upscale. would definitely come back!
Kendra was a lovely bartender, she knew what she was talking about and was so hospitable! Great drinks and an even better environment, even during the weekdays
Our favorite place to go! Great atmosphere, food, and of course drinks!
Kendra was awesome with my wife and I! The place was packed but she was very attentive to us and everyone around us. She was great and the drinks were great! We will definitely be back!
Emma is the greatest bartender on earth
The bartender Maia was very attentive and one of the best in the city. Great conversation and banter
Great beer!
One of my fav places to come on the weekends! Rashad and Maia are great and so friendly :)

Really enjoyed stopping in here on a recent trip for some beers. Beautiful and large space. Good space both indoors and outdoors. Liked the beer selection there and got a couple of the light beers that were very good. Great for just a few people or a large group.
Go every week and have the same person, Sara, at the register when I order my food, she's really great and makes the place feel very welcoming!  I always look forward to going!

Great beers and atmosphere! Great place for meeting friends and social spaces for vibing.
Highly recommend!
Got food poisoning from the turkey sandwich.

Throughout the work week I am consistently at the Sycamore Coffee Shop and have to give Jade a shoutout. She is the barista there daily and always has the best attitude, very helpful, and makes great coffee. I love seeing her as a familiar face week over week!

Will monetize on your personal data - someone needs to be held accountable for this. The only reason this is more annoying than Vinyl is because they try to be slick about it. Also will pretend not to be involved when they are #Not slick

The food is alright at best. The beer selection is good. The service? Well it's a "workaraunt". You go grab your own beer and your own food. The place is LOUD. Like no conversation is possible LOUD. Restaurant has a great outside location but no space heaters. That means it's impossible to hang out outside. Maybe a cool college pre-game hang out spot.

Great outdoor seating spaces; picnic tables and tables with individual chairs + dogs allowed.
Indoors is roomy but very noisy when crowded despite the high ceilings.
Food? Excellent. Beer selection? Even better. Service? TOP NOTCH! Jennifer is the best. Everyone should come and enjoy the views and the company! Love this place
Jennifer went above and beyond to help me and my friends with our food orders! Super sweet and will be coming back
Taproom social media manager posts weird stuff - other than that it's chill. I like the main account manager

I have been waiting for over an hour for my food, I have seen what appears to be my food in the window for the last 30 mins just sitting, asked the employee if that was our food, she said I can't get my food until they text me, this place is completely dead and not that busy, I will never come to this place again, service is completely pathetic, could not imagine more lazy employees than this.
I got the turkey sandwich from here... couple hours later I began vomiting nearly every 20 minutes for over 7 hours- food poisoning anyone?

Great place with great staff!! I grab my coffee in the morning from Jade and she is THE BEST!!  I get my Lunch from Jennifer, always positive and always finds the bright side of the situation!!  Great food, great beers and wonderful staff!!

Let me first start off with - I love sycamore for the brewery aspect and my fave bartender Maia is amazing.

However the reason i'm giving 2 stars is because i don't recommend sycamore cafe if you have the girl i had today. She was rude, short and the coffee she made tasted terrible. I was bright and good vibes since I know Mondays can be a little gloomy. I walked in and stood at the lunch/dinner counter because I didn't realize the coffee was over to the left since it was my first time going for coffee. Off jump, she was rude pointing to where the coffee was and immediately said she only had drip coffee, which is totally fine. That's all I wanted. But the attitude she had for the rest of the transaction really rubbed me the wrong way. I will try again if she is not working.
Great espresso martini

It took two tries to find Sycamore and the second was only because we'd found street parking. There is a parking deck but we did a quick in-and-out because there is no need to pay that much for parking in South End when there are other places that parking is free.

Sycamore is on the Rail Trail and faces the light rail. Once you understand that, it's super easy to get to, especially on foot or you can take the train. It's between East/West and the soon to be built Southline station.

Sycamore is fancy. Lots of exposed wood, great lighting and tables all about. Expect it to be full of local young professionals drinking and enjoying nibbles. The pizza looked great and they have burgers too.

We went with a group of 7 with small kids too. They have good outdoor sitting area with large picnic tables and many high tables. Really big outdoor sitting area with beautiful lighting in the evening. The place really look cool and happening in the evening. There is live music but it was over by the time we reached. Few food truck options are there but nothing great, but decent choice. Good collection of beer.
Made a joke to my friend about his name, server got offended, and had security throw us out. Terrible service.
Great drinks but terrible customer service. Nobody says hi. Just pay and leave
Very happening even in mid week. Must place to visit and the area around.
bartender has no idea what's going on around him. stood there for like 7 mins as he kept looking at me but never came over

The prices were really steep. $10 for a tall pilsner isn't great and $7 for a short isn't any better. The apple cider was pretty rank but the churro beer was surprisingly really good! 3.5/5 but I'll round up since the bartenders were nice and the environment was as well
Racist bar. Despicable. Terrible place.
Cool place, good beers.
Best brewery in Charlotte. Friendly staff, amazing beer & great food. Highly recommend, 10/10.
Love music, great beer, friendly faces, warm food, what more can you actually ask for.

Had a great experience watching the dodgers win the World Series! The staff was super attentive and the beers kicked ass! Shout out to the manager for putting on the sound and making sure we had the best time.
Great spot in south end! Good vibes, friendly staff! Best place to day drink!!!
Amazing atmosphere x amazing beers
Great beers and vibes. Staff very accommodating and knowledgeable.

Love coming to sycamore, always a fun time when they host events, good music and DJ's! The sandwiches and pizzas are really good, and have a good selection of beers and mixed drinks! Definitely the spot to go to bring your pups too!
The best ever. Amazing space and the team is 10/10. Mike is amazing and makes you feel at home every visit

This place is great for locals and visitors!! The space is so unique where you forget you are you are even within an office building. Everytime I have gone the staff has been amazing and attentive. For how busy they get I have never felt like I waited long for service. Highly recommend checking this place out!

Love this place! Beer is great the food is amazing. Cant go to this place and not get one of their burgers. Live music Djs and a family friendly environment cant beat it. Even the employees look like they enjoy being on the clock there. For sure a place to try
Love coming here with my friends! Always great music and great vibes!

Manager in the pink shirt tonight is very unprofessional and standoffish, does not know how to talk to customers, talked to me like I work here. 10 out of 10 hates his job and takes it out on customers.
Good beer and always have seasoning nal beers. Location/space is great. Food is overpriced and underwhelming, don't come here to eat.
I was really looking forward to planning a private event at the brewery. But after over two weeks of calls and emails with no response, I'll be taking my business elsewhere. Disappointing.
Huge fan of Sycamore beer and we were delighted to try it from the source! Friendly staff and great outdoor seating and music selection. Grabbed us a few packs to bring home!

We walked into this brewery at about 11:50 PM on a Saturday night and 3 out of 4 of our group was served. We were not told that the entire brewery closed at 12 AM. After making our way to the rooftop and taking a seat, we were told to make our way downstairs as they were closing. We sat on the ground level inside and were then told to make our way outside shortly after sitting as they were closing. We sat on the patio and were then decided we were going to make our way to the next bar that was open later on a Saturday night. As we were leaving, we decided to take a picture with the lantern lights behind us but were then harassed by 2 bouncers that we needed to leave immediately, mind you as we were literally walking towards the exit. We asked if we could take 5 seconds to take a quick picture to which we were told "you had the last 10 minutes to take a picture, I have somewhere to be" to which I replied it would take literally 10 seconds. We were then stared at while taking a quick picture and then we continued on to somewhere that actually stays open till a decent hour on a Saturday night in a city, QC Pourhouse, so shout out to them! Much better service/atmosphere. Absolutely rude and unnecessary attitude from the bouncers as we were on the PATIO where any other people were lingering. Will NOT be returning here and I hope they find different well mannered bouncers.
Great gameday atmosphere with equally great beer selections!
I visited this place last night with my friend and really enjoyed the live music, drinks, and food. I love that it's pet-friendly, too! I'll definitely be back!
Music's awful - Charlotte house music "banging" in the evening, and the afternoon some acoustic guys screaming thru a 500watt system when 50 would be just fine. But you'll wanna drink
The frozen espresso martini contains MDMA.

Food was good, wine special was a decent price with a selection typical of a brewery.
I visited during music bingo, the volume was very high the entire time. I had to constantly raise my voice to be heard by the person next to me. Even when bingo ended, the volume of music was continually very high.
Supposedly there was parking validation, or we thought there was? I was charged the normal evening rate posted, so it would be useful to specify what validation is offered, if any.
There is no clear signage from the street, you enter into a very office/corporate looking building. I felt safe, there was also a security attendant sitting in the foyer of the building. Decor is high end and elegant, seating is plentiful, the bar area was kept very clean by employees. Service was fast and polite.
This is a good place to visit if you want an elevated atmosphere but with casual food and beer.
Would be nice if they answered their phone. Called 3 days in a row at different times to see if they have my credit card but got no answer.
Food was pretty good, service was very much not. But I guess there's not a lot of options in the terminal.
Short rib and mushroom pizza is amazing

I went there yesterday (friday night) and they had football playing at MAX VOLUME. It wasn't busy inside and i still couldn't hold a conversation with the person next to me. The drinks were also insanely expensive for what they are. I will not be back and do not recommend.

Atmosphere is really great for both couples nd groups.

Food options are not that great.
Amazing atmosphere. The beer was delicious. It was a little loud with all of the people during happy hour, but plenty of places to sit.
Worst chicken wings!!
Run club was fun. Great atmosphere

I've been coming to sycamore since before it remodeled and I LOVED the last space. Since it remodeled/moved it's felt very aesthetic and didn't really feel like the old sycamore. I've had trouble with all the bartenders since it reopened being just very rude and short-- until tonight! Nate was working the bar upstairs and was just fantastic. Honestly the best bartender I've had, in Charlotte, in a long time. Hope he gets the recognition he deserves because he made our night!

Beer and pizza was good.  I emailed the brewery and got no answer on my issue with dogs on top of the tables.  I understand everyone loves their dog, however dogs don't belong on top of the tables.  There were several dogs on tables and the staff did not ask the owners to take them off the tables. This is a health safety concern that is not being addressed.
Great beer and vibe!!
I love customer service this placed lacked drastically will be out of business if they don't start recruiting quality service representatives
Favorite Spot

SUPER rude and hateful experience with a bartender. My friends and I just moved to Charlotte this month after graduating from college and heard wonderful reviews about Sycamore. The atmosphere was great but our bartender was SO rude to us. We waited in line for 10-15 minutes(pretty normal) and two of the girls I was with got their drinks. Then my friend and I handed her our ID and cards and she just told us "no". She said she refused to serve us and when we asked why she said it was because we had fake IDs. We told her they were real and that we just moved here and she was just straight up rude to us and told us we needed to go to the cop down stairs. Even the strangers around us were like "No way she just actually denied y'all that was crazy". She caused a scene and was so mean to us. We then went downstairs (there were no cops) and had to wait in line again to get a drink and this time the bartender was so sweet. The group I was with couldn't believe the way she treated us.
Absolutely massive spot. I went twice on a weekend, once in the day and once at night. Much busier at night. Cool views, fun atmosphere, and really interesting selections!

Good atmosphere, good beverage selection, and pretty decent food! Drinks and food are a little on the pricey side. The decor and design of the new location is quite nice though! Very Very different from the original Sycamore brewery. Love the 2nd floor balcony

Stopped in during our quick trip to Charlotte. I love the atmosphere here! It's so airy and open with a great outdoor space. It was super busy when we went (Saturday after July 4th), but we found a spot to sit on one of the picnic tables outside. My Caesar salad was delicious and my cider was so crisp and refreshing! This would be a great stop on a nice day. Would definitely go back!

Went there for a drink and the bartender did not wanted to serve us because we had a Puertorican License!

This was on the rooftop, the bartender has long hair and a mustache
The space is absolutely beautiful. However, the Events Coordinator- Emily is uncommunicative and we were so excited to have our welcome drinks for our wedding here.

Fun time at Sycamore with a large group of family and friends. We met shortly after noon on a Saturday and were able to get two large tables together under the cover/shaded area. Things are self service, so you get up and order your own food and beer. Beer was nice and the food is typical bar food. Will definitely go back for beers but will probably grab food somewhere else.
Good location but bad service

We had a good experience here.  The outside music was one dude, and it was annoyingly loud over powering any conversations. So we moved upstairs.  Nice breeze, shaded, upstairs bar and an Airstream,
The beer was really good.  The bartender gal was extremely helpful and explained the beers well assisting us with samples to hone in on what be we'd like.  All in all, it was a good time, we'll be back. There are lots of other places to check out in the area within a lil walk as well.
They always have vegan options!

I was very excited to go to this place. It's cute and I enjoyed my beer. However, I was supposed to get text when my food was ready. You have to serve yourself. I waited for an hour and finally went down to check and the kitchen was closed. There was a burger that looked like it had been sitting there for a long time. The server put the blame on me but I never got a text. The bun was rock hard on top and the fries were dried out from sitting there. The kitchen was closed so they couldn't do much for me besides give me new buns and refund. At this point the places I would have gone to get dinner instead we're also closed. Not sure if I just got unlucky but not super eager to return. Also, I specifically requested my burger well done and it was not even close.
We loved the place, a super nice atmosphere, the service and you can bring your pet with you four legged friend, a full variety of beers. Recommended.

The dogs are unmanaged and out of control. I couldn't even hear our conversation over the dogs barking and running around. I had to move up stairs which didn't help much. As there loud barks and fighting/ screams echo off the building and almost as loud upstairs.
Great place! Good beers!
Bartenders are extremely rude and refuse service. I would rather eat dirt than go to this bar.
I was denied with a real 21+ ID. If you want a good bar experience I would avoid this place.
Bougie no doubt, but darn me if that frozen marg didn't hit the spot on a hot day!
I experienced horrible service and horrible drinks. Just my experience.
I love sycamore so much. It's the best brewery in Charlotte. Here multiple times a week. Please consider changing the ranch recipe, it's the only thing I hold against this place.
I really like the space itself. Would be nice if they branched out to have a more robust selection of beer styles.
Beer and burger were both great. However I flew into Charlotte on a Monday night and I didn't know the kitchen closes at 9. I did not see any info about the kitchen closing time on the website.

While I don't really drink beer, this is a great place to come for a cup of coffee as well.  It's also a good place to hang out and work with a cup of coffee on weekdays when it isn't crowded.  Everyone is very nice here.

Great place to grab lunch and try one of their delicious drinks. Also their food is really good, my BLT and fries were perfect. Another plus it's pet friendly, bc i love to take my pups out
Will be coming back!
Update: Had a good time during Dog Mom event with my two pups! Love this place for being dog friendly
Goat cheese dip was a hit! It's Mothers Day, and my wife is very critical of most dips. However, this dip hit the spot and made for a wonderful time on the patio.
Really nice place, large outside, good beer good food
Very rude bartenders. My drink was too strong I asked to add some more lemonade, but apparently they couldn't do it.
The beer Yoga was bussin almost as good as the cold beer
Still one of the best breweries in CLT. Parking is a bear though. Take an Uber, scooter, or the Light Rail to get here.
awesome spot! will be coming back - and this is coming from someone who doesn't like beer haha
What a beautiful place to hang out with friends and enjoy an adult beverage. Sure wish that there would be a place like this up in PA. We will definitely stop by again next time we are in the area

The new location is extremely nice! Almost a little bit too nice, everything is wood and wood veneer with multiple places and multiple bars to order from. Full food lineup, the whole works. Two-story taproom with tons of space and places to hang out. It's absolutely enormous!
Great place and atmosphere

Great place to hangout at! Downstairs had a coffee area, food, and a nice bar. Upstairs had 2 different bar areas and a great outdoors section. Definitely needs bigger restrooms, it was packed and crowded and long lines there.

The bartenders were friendly, the drinks were great. My favorite was the frozen expresso martini or the strawberry mule.

Would come back! Hopefully less busy next time. Hard to get through crowds.

The good: Tasty beers and fun atmosphere. The layout is awesome.

Reason I'm leaving 1 star: My buddies were all there to watch the NCSU & UNC ACC game and with 60 seconds left, one of the employees moved a large heater right in front of the TV. My friend tried to move the heater, which led the employee to come up behind, put him in a chokehold, and attempt bringing him to the ground. Should my friend have asked to move the heater? Of course. However, at no point should an employee in the customer service industry lay their hands on a customer, unless they are trying to deescalate a situation. What I assumed to be management came after and when I tried to explain the situation, they decided to kick us all out. This all felt very thuggish and I had to debate calling the police. I'm leaving this review to hopefully get some sort of corrective action from management. At no point should an establishment condone violent escalation.
St Paddy rockin

This is the first brewery I was taken to on my visit from Colorado, and it didn't disappoint! The Mountain Candy was my go to throughout the night, I loved the setup and super friendly staff. Apparently it's a solid place on a sunny day, can't wait to go back!

If a band is there, prepare to yell at the person next to you to have a conversation. I wonder if bars say to themselves "let's have a great vibe for people to come hangout and talk. Then let's put a band right next to them so they can't talk."

Arrived at 4pm it already felt like a club super loud and hard to hear.
Beer was just ok. Better places to visit in the area
This place is super cool. I love everything about this place

I would have loved to pay with cash when I came here. Was informed that they have gone cashless after ordering a drink. We are quickly moving towards a technocratic society, and losing our last bits of privacy remaining. Will not be coming back here until they start accepting cash again!
Parents beware : no changing table in women's or men's bathroom. Wonderful otherwise but it's incredibly frustrating that this brewery doesn't take parents into account.
They can't let you use the restroom at closing which is inhumane
Great brewery but there's no baby changing tables. If you have a LO it's probably best to go somewhere else
Sycamore is a Charlotte institution.

We love their beer. Buy it all the time! That mountain candy!! Yes! They have an area with floor pillows that my kids loved jumping around. We totally took over the area. Big negative... no changing table in the bathroom! I mean... parents need beer too! Please please put a changing table in both men's and woman's restrooms. I'd love to give this place a 5 star

A captivating locale adorned with tastefully crafted interiors that exude youthful vibrancy. This vibrant space is a haven for those seeking an enticing atmosphere, perfect for socializing and experiencing an enjoyable time. With its dynamic ambiance and stylish design, it's an exceptional spot to unwind, socialize, and revel in moments of pure delight.
Great beer. Really like the decor and vibe. Music was a little too loud personally.
Really cool place with excellent beer

Came for anniversary.  Nice atmosphere but...I bought 2 specialty bacon garlic truffle burgers.  Both delivered without the bacon, the garlic aoili or the truffle butter.  Wait staff said they were out of all ingredients so we just got a patty between bread and we paid a premium for it!!  We even tipped well, which you have to do before you get your food.  Also you have to go to the counter and order, as well as go pick up your food.  You have to go get your drinks.  Why do you have to tip?  Waiters work for theirs.  These people arent waiters.  Staff gave me some lettuce and tomato and some fried pickles to make it better.  Offered to get my wife something else, but we already waited 45 min and weren't about to wait another 45 minutes.  Why are bathrooms always out of soap.  Fun times

First time at the new taproom. There's so much space! Great outdoor area with heaters, sofas and tables. The interior areas were really loud, but there is a great  quiet lounge area (Beer garden)with sofas and comfy chairs. So it has something for everyone. There's even a connection to the parkimg deck so super easy parking which is rare for that area of town!
Kid friendly area with floor pillows
Good beer, cocktails, and food.
Good brewery.  Parking was expensive in garage. Beer was pretty good.

Terrible service! Long time fan of Sycamore beers and first time to the new space but not a good experience. My wife and I were there on a weekday mid-afternoon. It was not busy at all. The woman behind the bar completely ignored us for about 5 minutes and continued to chat away with 2 other customers who already had their beers, so she wasn't talking about their beer or what they should order. Finally, another woman came around the corner from the other side of the bar, where I think she was attending to a private party. She offered to help us and the first woman finally acknowledged us and took our order. After we had our beers, we noticed some beer on display and wanted to buy a 4-pack of them. The same server said they didn't have any of that beer at the bar and sent us to the other end of their space. That guy said they didn't have any but there might be some in the mini-fridges behind the bar. Went back to the bar and she couldn't find any but 2 other workers dug through the fridge and found 4 singles of that beer. SMH
Good spot

I love Sycamore beer buy them all the time. I waited all Year for the Christmas Cookie Winter Ale and I'm  not as impressed as last Christmas. Last Christmas I was buy Three 4 packs a week loved the taste. Maybe it's me but something is off from last seasons batch.

This place recently(?) had a renovation, trading in the small cozy brewery vibe for a large modern/club vibe. While some may miss the cosy vibe, the new atmosphere provides a nice energy, plenty of places to sit, and various areas to explore.

The beer selection was pretty on par what you'd expect, plenty of choices. I'd recommend the Vanilla Southern Girl.

I'm knocking off a star because the food was nothing to write home about. If you need some incredibly average, over priced bar food, you'll be happy. Otherwise, eat before you come.

Overall, would go back. But would eat first.
Great experience and environment
The Pumpkin Spiced Latte is great but it kept me up all night

I was so excited to finally visit the new Sycamore brewery in South End on a Saturday afternoon.  Sycamore makes fantastic beer, and I love their Mountain Candy IPA and Southern Girl Blonde Ale.  The new location is an impressive two-story building, and there is plenty of seating.  For lunch, I had the roast beef sandwich that I really enjoyed.  My date had a pizza, and she let me try a slice.  The food was delicious.  Sycamore is a brewery that is one of the best in Charlotte, and I highly recommend visiting.
The Cucumber Mule was delicious!!! The pickle fries were very tasty. Great atmosphere for an after work social.
Fast and friendly service with a great atmosphere. Delicious pretzels and cider.
Great new location!!

A brewery / taproom that doesn't do flights (at least as of right now, October '23). That's disappointing, and I take a star away for that.

Otherwise I love the location. It's huge, with plenty of seating, and a large outdoor space that's lovely on a beautiful day. Clean and bright vibe. This would make a great group get-together spot.
Went to their oktoberfest. They have lots of space over two floors with a bar(beer) on each. Their on-site kitchen has some great options.
Nice outdoor space and great beer.
Kendra was the beast bartender!!! So welcoming and friendly!
Wanted to give a quick shoutout to Brooks- I accidentally got overcharged and he helped me sort it out! (:

Finally stopped here after the reopening and LOVED it! It has so much open seating and incredibly dog friendly. My sister and I had our two large dogs with us and right as we walked up we were brought a big bucket of water and treats for the dogs. We got a burger and pizza for dinner which was also delicious. We will definitely be back!
Great spot

Liked the old place and this one too. Love the Mountain Candy IPA. Only complaint is they need to do a much better job with cleanliness. Bathroom get really bad when busy. Experienced this three times already in last two months.
Great beer and atmosphere. Thought the food needed to be better

Emily nailed it with the service, and that americano was top-tier. Tried their salmon salad on a previous visit, and it didn't disappoint. The upstairs ambiance with the live tunes is a solid vibe. Just a heads up: they could use a few more non-alcoholic cold drink options. Definitely worth a drop-in if you're in the area. 5/5.
When I think of good service the vm came over and made an effort for ensure the service was right. Regardless that makes the difference.
The new Sycamore is awesome. Good beer and nice atmosphere.
My only complaint is the echo inside -- it's extremely overwhelming, they weren't even packed, but the din was pretty intense. I hope they consider hanging some sound barriers soon?

Today's food, Not good at all. Very disappointing!! I came last weekend and had the avocado toast which was Awesome, came to have it again as my weekly brunch. They changed it, NOT WORTH IT AND NOT GOOD!! Sucks!
That's the issue with this, Charlotte can't keep consistency. Now I will look for another place for brunch. Just sad!!
Absolutely worst bar in Charlotte. Cynthia was the worst server we've ever had. So many options, stay away from this one.

I'd score lower than this but the service was absolutely atrocious. Rude and vindictive. I had a party of 20 and they refused to service because we got off a pedal pub that they promote for their bar with beer.

Why would they not accept cash? Bartender poured my beer, I handed her the cash, and she told me she couldn't accept cash. I told her my boyfriend went ahead to another bar, so I just had my ID and cash. She went to bat for me with the manager who could not care less and looked irritated that she was even asking him. Beer ended up down the drain, and we took our money elsewhere
Love the new location and set up. Frozen espresso martini is amazing!

I visited the new taproom for the first time a few weeks ago. The atmosphere was great, however the bartender that tried to take mine & my friends (real) IDs ruined the experience for us. When I asked why she would be keeping mine she stated, with a terrible attitude, that it was fake. After arguing with her, she took both of our IDs again and then comes back to say it was actually my friends that was fake and that she'd be keeping it. She eventually got a manager and the situation was resolved and we were both served, but the way she handled this interaction was extremely distasteful. If she had concerns about the legitimacy of our IDs then fine, but she was rude & couldn't even remember which ID she was so confident was fake. Also, bartenders have no authority to confiscate IDs so I should have never had to argue to get mine back. All in all, I just hope they provide staff some training on checking IDs & how to properly handle these situations.
The atmosphere is great with live music and a great selection of drinks! Good spot to stop on the light rail trail! Highly recommend it!

One of my favorite breweries in the country.
Amazing new location with tons of space.  However I feel like the new location has sold out a bit .  They no longer can any of their amazing seasonal brews for take away, just too bad.

I had the pleasure of visiting The New Sycamore Brewery in Charlotte, NC, and I can confidently say that it exceeded all of my expectations. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. The attention to detail in the design and decor is truly impressive, creating a trendy and comfortable space that's perfect for both casual outings and special occasions.

The selection of craft beers is nothing short of outstanding. Each brew boasts a unique and robust flavor profile, a testament to the expertise of the brewers. Whether you're a seasoned beer connoisseur or just starting to explore the world of craft beer, you're sure to find something that delights your taste buds.

The food offerings are equally remarkable. The menu is thoughtfully curated, featuring a variety of dishes that cater to different palates. I was particularly impressed by the quality of ingredients and the presentation of the dishes. It's evident that the kitchen staff takes great pride in their work.

One of the standout features of The New Sycamore Brewery is its spacious outdoor area. The expansive patio provides ample seating, and the vibrant energy makes it an ideal spot to unwind with friends or family. The live events and entertainment offerings add an extra layer of enjoyment to the overall experience.

From the friendly and knowledgeable staff to the top-notch beverages and cuisine, The New Sycamore Brewery is a gem in Charlotte's culinary and social scene. Whether you're a local resident or just passing through, this establishment is an absolute must-visit. I can't wait to return and create more wonderful memories at this remarkable brewery.
Hosted a retirement party here and it turned out great.  Food and drink options were A+, and the service was perfect.
First time in new location and I was so impressed with the space and food! I had the antipasto salad with chicken and it was so delicious and large!!!!! Looking forward to our next visit!
Great atmosphere. Fun place to hang out on the weekends or to grab a beer after work. They have a large selection of beers and fun events.

Worst experience ever, I'm a single with a dog in Charlotte, I understand the rules about dogs but with no dog allowed inside or upstairs how can I order a beer . Tried waving down staff and was ignored , as soon as I took one step inside I got scolded . Sycamore used to be dog friendly . I felt like I was unwelcome .

Always good beer, food is good and they've definitely tried to create a relaxing atmosphere and done it. But........ If you go on the second level, stay inside or close to the center. The smell of pet urine coming up over the side rail is pretty overwhelming at times, that's a major disgusting turnoff. Especially during these hot summer days.

I would like to address my review to the owners Sarah and Justin:) I have loved Sycamore brewing from the very beginning. I have spent so many happy days with friends and family at your brewery both old and fabulous new location!! So beautiful and such a cool vibe!!
But I have a request:) I would like to ask for some NA beer options please:) my favorite canned NA beers are from Untitled Art. Many styles and flavors! And just bc you no longer drink alcohol doesn't mean you don't still love the taste of beer!
I would also challenge you to be the first brewery in our area to brew a NA beer!
I am and always will be a huge fan of Sycamore and have enjoyed watching your success!! Thanks for one of the coolest spots in Charlotte!

This place trashes the rail trail with booming annoying music at 8 am , leaves dozens of electric scooters haphazardly blocking the trail , and places all their trash onto the trail and onto the light rail which is hazardous.

Apesar de nao conhecer muitas cervejarias em Charlotte, essa parece ser uma das melhores.
Cerveja e bons drinks, bastante gente.
5/5 Food, Atmosphere, Sycamore is now the epitome of a great time in Charlotte. The Food was 10/10 Incredibly well thought and delicious.
Rude staff
If you are an enormous douchebag or a 19 year old girl you'll f'n love getting ham sauced at this place.

There were no less than 2,000 people there. Even though it was busy, we found a table and the bar was extremely efficient with getting us our orders. The upstairs area with the airstream trailer had live music.

New location is super nice well laid out, but the one complaint I do have is that there's no changing table in any of the bathrooms. Considering there's a kids menu offered, you'd think this would've been a given to install. There were a lot of families and babies there, so might want to consider adding one.
Service from sous chef absolutely incredible. To see him cleaning tables and still getting things done is amazing. Overall great experience

I hate to be a Karen but for the number of babies I saw there on a Saturday afternoon, I was annoyed there wasn't a changing table in the bathrooms! I had to change my baby on the floor which was gross. And don't come at me about breweries not being for kids. This place has a literal kids menu!

Was excited to visit my favorite Charlotte brewery after the new openings today. I drove over an hour from Columbia, SC and arrived around 3:30/4 with my dog, it was packed as usual. There were signs all over stating dogs were not allowed upstairs or inside. My issue is the only place to get a drink is inside, no outside bar. I went in to get a drink and was promptly told I could not have my dog inside. I asked where do I get a drink and was told I had to wait for an outside bar to open. I asked when will it be opened and was told "I don't know". Needless to say I will not be back

Great beer and atmosphere. I really like the Mountain Candy which distributes at least around NC, maybe further. This location is huge with lots of outdoor seating and space for groups. We had a group of 8 and had no trouble getting a spot that fit all of us. The food is good. I got a roast beef sandwich that was delicious.

It's a little hard to find if you're driving up as I never saw a sign that faced the road I was driving on. There's a few parking garages close by which for weeknight parking was $10.
Super cool place !!!

The renovations to this place are INCREDIBLE! Added cafe, rooftop terrace, way more seating, multiple bars, so much more to an already amazing establishment! I already loved Sycamore and now I love it even more!
Heads up - their new location is dog friendly only outside!

The new taproom is certainly an improvement over the last location.  Offering a full menu isn't always common at a brewery so this is great.  There are a couple of areas that can be improved upon.  1. The beers are served in plastic cups.  Glassware would be a welcome addition. 2. They do not serve flights.  With this many beers on tap this is a major disappointment.  3.  The indoor space is too loud. There isn't anything soft inside the taproom. This causes the entire indoor area to be difficult to talk with the person beside you.
One thing Sycamore did correctly: not allowing dogs inside or upstairs.
Not sure if double mountain candy is 300 ml because it has more alcohol , what a crazy logic .:: either staff or owner might have been drunk more then me lol

Rude staff. They have less beer. They don't give 10z equal to 300ml also. They used their wit to tell double mountain candy has 'more alochol hence they gave less than 300ml, I don't know staff might be under trained.
Super cute space with great beer and cocktail selection! Will definitely be back.
Loved the atmosphere and good drink selection. Only downside is they don't do tabs on weekend.

The new taproom is really nice, upstairs rooftop and downstairs has lots of seating. They have beer, cocktails and food.  We did go Thur around 4pm ish and it was slow, but around 6/7p it got super crowded.  If you're looking for more a chill time go early esp with kids, our 2 year old loved walking around.
Amazing brewing... delicious beer flavors really nice place! Just go to enjoy the cold beers  music
Food is expensive but good quality. Love the new space. We will definitely be back.
Great new location, tons of people, but good service. Loved the band.
Great vibes!
No cash, no dark beer, bathrooms are gross.  With all the money they got for their land, I was hoping they'd at least hire a good brewer.
Love the new space! The live music is a little too loud and makes it hard to hear the people you are sitting next too!

Too loud, extremely loud. Because of the building the echo makes everything super loud. It is also effects dogs too. And new dog policy they have is unfortunately not working for people who have dogs. They only let first floor outdoor area for dogs. The service is slow but they will get better eventually. Not favorite spot anymore. The way they designed the place is cute though.

Love the new location of Sycamore brewing - Taproom, Beer Garden & Cafe in Charlotte, North Carolina. It is a massive huge space with lots of light wood. They have a huge indoor taproom, a coffee shop, an amazing outdoor space and a beautiful roof deck. I have two dogs and I didn't bring them but they're only allowed outside downstairs. I love that they have their signature beers along with others plus cocktails and wine. I didn't get to try the food but I'm definitely going to next time. I can't wait to go back.
Great spot

Tried the new location. It hasn't even been open that long and it is disgusting all over inside. I do assume this is due to people just not caring about places or having the decency to take care of an establishment they frequent. Regardless it gets overly crowded and isn't even a shadow of the old establishment. I guess it would be decent to visit once but overall, in my opinion, there are better breweries throughout the area to visit.

You should not advertise your QR code menu if everything is right but the prices.  We had to wait through a 30 minute line to be told the prices weren't honored.  Also you should clarify that you don't accept cash. My $28 lunch ended up being $52

Also there was no soap in the men's bathroom and no changing tables in the men's bathroom.  Food was ok but there are some kinks to work out.
Beer is always good and cold!!!!
Great vibes!!!
Great place to bring your dogs and socialize.

Our favorite visit in Charlotte 

Great selection of beer, wine and cocktails. Food was also great. Atmosphere tops it off!

Multiple bars upstairs and downstairs. Airstream upstairs sells cans of beer.

Downstairs many dining areas offer different vibes. It was very busy and loud when we visited but found a space that we could sit outside the front door.

Views of the trail, light rail and south end are great.

Dogs are allowed, but only outside

Went to the re-opening/opening of the new location. They originally let people on the second floor patio then decided later to abruptly kick everyone out that had dogs. Didn't matter we had been there for hours with an open tab, two guys with black security shirts kicked everyone out. We weren't even allowed to finish our drinks. Terrible customer service
Not very dog friendly. Dogs are not allowed inside or upstairs. Miss the old place.
Not the same! The old place was much better. Sadly, the new place lost its charm. I will not return. I guess I'm buying their beer from Harris teeter. This is a no go. Sorry.

Title: A Disappointing Change: Sycamore's New Dog Policy

Rating: 

Sycamore has always been a favorite spot for dog owners to gather and enjoy a pleasant meal with their furry companions. However, a recent change in their policy has left a sour taste in the mouths of many loyal patrons. The decision to prohibit dogs upstairs on their outdoor balcony or inside the premises has undoubtedly altered the once-welcoming atmosphere of this popular establishment.

One of the main draws of Sycamore was its dog-friendly environment, which created a unique and inclusive atmosphere. The outdoor balcony provides the perfect setting for dog owners to relax, savor their meals, and bond with their four-legged friends. Sadly, this cherished feature has been abruptly stripped away, leaving dog owners feeling unwelcome and excluded.

The rationale behind this decision remains unclear. While it is essential to maintain a clean and hygienic space for all customers, there are numerous ways to achieve this without resorting to such drastic measures.w By completely banning dogs from the upper floor and indoor areas, Sycamore has alienated a significant portion of their customer base.

Moreover, the absence of dogs in the venue has led to a noticeable decline in the vibrant and lively ambiance that Sycamore was once known for. The joyous barks, wagging tails, and friendly interactions between dogs served as a heartwarming backdrop that made dining at Sycamore a truly unique experience. The lack of this vibrant energy has transformed the once-bustling venue into a more sterile and less inviting space.

While it is understandable that Sycamore may have encountered challenges or received complaints related to dogs in their premises, it is essential to remember that dogs are cherished members of many families. By banning them from 2/3 of the venue, the restaurant has alienated not only the dog owners but also the general community that enjoyed the presence of these furry companions.

Ultimately, Sycamore's decision to disallow dogs upstairs on their outdoor balcony or inside the venue is disappointing and has resulted in a noticeable decline in its overall charm. While cleanliness and customer satisfaction are undoubtedly important, there are alternative solutions that could have been explored to address any concerns without eliminating the dog-friendly atmosphere. Hopefully, Sycamore will reconsider this policy and restore its former appeal as a welcoming and inclusive establishment for both two-legged and four-legged visitors alike.
Southern Girl is one of the best beers I've ever had! Pretty much the only beer I buy in stores.
Great Beer
lager is weak.
Great brewery! This was my first visit. We will be back.
Outdoor area was great! Live band was amazing! Hope I talked him into Americas Got Talent and I see him one day! Overall.... GREAT experience! Visiting from Pittsburgh and this was best spot!
Just found this local gem, plan to return very soon! Kinda weird they don't serve miller lite
Lock doors before you close. Smh.
A great place with awesome fast service. Tons of space. They can handle a massive crowd and make it look easy. The beer's pretty good too! :)
Outdoor entertainment, food trucks, & a delicious Mango crushed cider. ANNNNDD you get to keep your color changinf cup! What more could you want?!
Very cool place to grab a brew, and maybe a live band or two outside on their patio area, or the open space in the back. When I went they also had several food trucks present.
Lots of fabulous food trucks and awesome beer on tap.
Delicious Drinks! Super clean environment! Will be back!
Good beer great times
Great IPAs

one of my favorite breweries in charlotte! huge selection of delicious beers, great atmosphere with live music and food trucks, and my dog loves it here! highly recommend if you're looking for an outdoor scenery
They closed at "10" but wouldn't let us in after 9:30. Ridiculous
Great spot for a beer and hanging out
Great beer, great music, great fun!
I dig it. Cool spot with lots of areas to hang out and good beer. Next time I am sure to be there for food trucks and music though

This is such a neat spot located very conveniently within Charlotte. Sycamore was a recommendation from a local as a place to go while in town. The drinks were all good, the vibe was nice, and the live music was on point. We spoke with one of the bartenders about possibly moving to Charlotte, and he helped instill some confidence in the city, going out of his way to tell us all about the ups, downs, and different things to do to stay busy. It was a great time! I can't wait to come back.

I want to like Sycamore Brewing, I really do.  The vibe is great, the outside seating area is spacious and cute, they're dog friendly and offer lots of different drink options.  My issue is I went for the very first time and did not have a great first experience.  The bartender was pretty snotty, yes it was busy but there were maybe 5 people in line at the time I was ordering and there were 3 bartenders behind the bar.  Since I had never been I had no clue what they offered, how the beers taste etc.  The names are listed on the board but no description of what each one is and the bartender was "far too busy" to assist.  I asked for ONE sample and she said "Oh we don't do samples"  I told her it was my first time there and wanted to know how to find out which one I like and she "I guess you don't."  I ordered my husband's beer, which I did not like and we listened to the band while he drank.  My husband then went an ordered me a frozen paloma for a whopping $10 and it was disgusting.  Did not taste like a paloma at all!  I would try again but if I get the same "awesome" service I won't be back, there are plenty of other places in the area that are eager to please.
Loved the beer the open market and the food trucks  were awesome
Nice atmosphere.  They let you try beers. Good selection and service.

Happen to be in town for their annual Spring Fest! Place was extremely organized and all the staff were great. Hardly any wait for drinks and there had to be over 1500 people there. Oh yeah and the beer and selzers were amazing.
Spring fest

Dont buy tickets today hoping to take a 4 pack home  you will waste your time and money
They tell you yes then when you get to the bar they will not do it. Gave 8 drink tickets away because of a person telling you what you need to hear to make a sale. Disappointed
Lots of outdoor seating picnic tables with umbrellas.   Live music is great.  Fun place to be around. Lots of people. Spring fest is nuts
Overall pleasant experience. Solid place. Pretty good beer. Nice outdoor area which I'm sure gets pretty fun on weekend

I've gone several times for food truck Fridays and it is very fun! Very much traditional beer garden vibes- loads of outdoors picnic table style seating. Sometimes have live music too! I've enjoyed all the beers they've had on tap.
This place is a frathouse literally trying to be a brewery, or the other way around.
Love. Beer is great, bring your dog to hang out too, staff quick and friendly.
Good beer good vibes

Great beer, great space. Easy access to the rail trail. Lots of outdoor seating. Staff was very friendly. They had a food truck, mobile cigar bar AND mobile axe throwing while we were there. First time visiting but will definitely be back.
Love the beer, love the staff. Excited to see what the new building and outdoor area will be like when it's completed.
Great beer and staff. Must get here!
nice outdoor market
Lots of personality and great IPA
5 stars because of the beer
Fantastic. Great beer and 0 covids
Had a great time. Only thing was it was freezing outside!! The food was great from the choices of food trucks

Great beers, awesome outdoor beer garden, and the employees are awesome!!
Definitely recommend the Vanilla Affogado!
Fun place.  Good beers and cider.  Nice outside area.  Although it was super cold tonight!
Dog friendly brewery along the rail trail! Great selection on tap and spacious outdoor seating. Love running or biking to this spot! Often great food trucks around or events in their adjacent lot

Two Words...Special Brownies...

OMG...If you like stouts, this chocolate stout will knock your socks to the moon ....

The building is a redo with an industrial edge. It blends in perfectly with South end's redo. There was music playing when we got there. The volume was a bit loud, so we didn't stay.
Fun outdoor events and host for food truck. Beer was good!
Awesome atmosphere!!
